unnormalised: Someone asked if it's cheaper to buy vegetables at the local sabzi mandi or a big supermarket. Well, bhai, that's a loaded question! It's like asking if my mom's chai is better than Starbucks. Depends on what you're after, no?
normalised: Someone asked if it is cheaper to buy vegetables at the local sabzi mandi or a big supermarket. Well, bhai, that is a loaded question! It is like asking if my mom's chai is better than Starbucks. Depends on what you are after, no?

unnormalised: See, at the sabzi mandi, you might snag tomatoes for â‚¹20/kg if you haggle like a pro auntie. Supermarkets? Probably more like Rs. 45 per kg, looking all shiny and perfect. But then you gotta factor in the rickshaw ride to the mandi, which is usually Rs. 50 minimum, plus the time spent battling crowds. And don't forget the rogue cow eyeing your cauliflower! Supermarkets have AC, parking (usually costing Rs. 30/hour), and everything's nicely packaged, but your wallet cries a little.
normalised: See, at the sabzi mandi, you might snag tomatoes for rupee twenty per kilogram if you haggle like a pro auntie. Supermarkets? Probably more like rupees forty five per kilogram, looking all shiny and perfect. But then you gotta factor in the rickshaw ride to the mandi, which is usually rupees fifty minimum, plus the time spent battling crowds. And don't forget the rogue cow eyeing your cauliflower! Supermarkets have A-C, parking (usually costing rupees thirty per hour), and everything is nicely packaged, but your wallet cries a little.

unnormalised: So, is it cheaper? Maybe. Is it an adventure? Absolutely! Think of the sabzi mandi as a treasure hunt where the prize is slightly bruised but delightfully cheap veggies. Supermarket is the chill, predictable option. Depends if you're feeling lucky, or just plain hungry and want to pay Rs 10 for a plastic bag!
normalised: So, is it cheaper? Maybe. Is it an adventure? Absolutely! Think of the sabzi mandi as a treasure hunt where the prize is slightly bruised but delightfully cheap veggies.
